channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why whatever’s happening in Venezuela isn’t ‘regime change’
item.description: Regime change refers to something far more ambitious and far more consequential than plucking out a single leader.

item.title: Why Trump’s Venezuela strike may have been about Cuba as much as it was about oil
item.description: Nicolas Maduro’s capture has effectively taken away Cuba’s closest ally.

item.title: A lifeline in real time
item.description: In the heart of Aceh province in northwestern Sumatra, the Ketiara Cooperative, led by the remarkable Ibu Rahmah, is facing a crisis unfolding as we s...

item.title: Who needs AI deepfakes when the Trump government can dispute video evidence that we can plainly see?
item.description: In the age of rampant AI slop, seeing isn’t always believing. There’s more than one way, though, to make people doubt their own eyes. Many have long p...

item.title: Google billionaire Larry Page copies the Jeff Bezos playbook, buying a $173 million Miami compound that will save him millions in taxes
item.description: Critics warned a wealth tax in California would lead to a billionaire exodus. Florida says come on in, the water's warm.

item.title: Michael Bloomberg and Warren Buffett agree on advice to Gen Z: Choose vibes over money in your job search
item.description: Bloomberg took a lower salary for his first job out of school because he preferred the people who interviewed him.

item.title: Why Entrepreneurs Mistake Busyness for Real Progress
item.description: Being busy may feel productive; real progress is measured by outcomes, not motion.

item.title: Hermès’ hand-illustrated website is the ultimate luxury
item.description: If you visit the Hermès website in search of a scarf or a handbag, you’ll be greeted by a collection of whimsical sea creatures swimming across the sc...

item.title: Design Interfaces That Move Heavy Ideas Forward
item.description: The heavier the system, the lighter the touch design must have

item.title: I’m the SolarWinds CEO. Here’s why a $4.4 billion move to go private was right for us
item.description: Looking back, the deal succeeded not because we pushed harder or moved faster, but because we stayed balanced.

item.title: Workplaces are integrating nature to bring balance and calm. Here’s how
item.description: The crisp crinkle of fallen leaves beneath your feet. The swish and trickle of water moving through a stream. A breath of crisp, fresh air. Spending t...

item.title: 5 ways Trump’s proposed institutional single-family homebuying ban could affect the housing market
item.description: Want more housing market stories from Lance Lambert’s ResiClub in your inbox? Subscribe to the ResiClub newsletter . On Wednesday, President Donald Tr...

item.title: Why Brand and Performance Marketing Work Better Together
item.description: Brand and performance are not opposing forces; they are multipliers.

item.title: These 10 Jobs Are Most Likely to Pay More in 2026
item.description: Certain AI-proof jobs are likely to earn higher compansation this year, but technology’s influence on the job market is unmistakable.

item.title: Microsoft Execs Respond to ‘Mass Layoff’ Rumors
item.description: They are pushing back, despite recent cuts at the company.
